required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cesarean Section Scar Evaluation by Saline Contrast Sonohysterography During Hysteroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Cesarean Section Scar Evaluation by Saline Contrast Sonohysterography During Hysteroscopy

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital

clinical_study.source: Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: To apply an existing diagnostic imaging test (saline infusion sonohysterography by Hysteroscopic) to characterize the "filling defect" of a previous cervical cesarean delivery scar in the nonpregnant uterus

primary_outcome.measure: Cesarean Section Scar Evaluation by TVU and MRI

arm_group.description: Cesarean Section Scar Evaluation by TVU
Cesarean Section Scar Evaluation by MRI
Cesarean Section Scar Evaluation by MRI with saline
Cesarean Section Scar Evaluation by Saline Contrast Sonohysterography During Hysteroscopy

study_pop.textblock: cesarean section diverticula patients in our hospital from 2016 to Dec 2018.The diagnosis was confirmed on the basis of medical history (at least one C-section), clinical symptoms (post¬menstrual spotting, no significant change of cycle before and after C-section),transvaginal ultrasonography (TVU), and mag¬netic resonance imaging (MRI) findings

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
cesarean section diverticula patients in our hospital from 2016 to Dec 2018.The diagnosis was confirmed on the basis of medical history (at least one C-section), clinical symptoms (post¬menstrual spotting, no significant change of cycle before and after C-section),transvaginal ultrasonography (TVU), and mag¬netic resonance imaging (MRI) findings
Exclusion Criteria:
1) irregular menstrual cycle before cesar¬ean section; 2) previous placement of an intrauterine contracep¬tive device; and 3) presence of another organic uterine pathology responsible for abnormal uterine bleeding examined by hysteroscopy, such as endome-trial hyperplasia, endometrial polyps, malignancy, or submucosal myomas

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Gynecology, Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital, affiliated to Tongji University

facility.name: Department of Gynecology, Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital, affiliated to Tongji University
